place_of_publication.other_info: based on A. maritima Eastwood, Bull. Torrey Bot. Club 30: 501. 1903, not E. Sheldon 1903

treatment.description: Leaves mostly reclining to prostrate; blades oblanceolate to spatulate, 4–10(–13) cm × (10–)15–30 mm, margins mostly toothed to lobed, lobes oblanceolate to spatulate, faces often densely villous. Phyllaries ovate to obovate, margins mostly densely tomentose, densely villous to tomentose (hairs translucent, mostly yellow), ± stipitate-glandular. Corollas surpassing phyllaries at flowering, 8–16 mm; anthers 3.5–4.5 mm. Cypselae ± dimorphic, whitish or purplish, ribs ridged to subalate, straight, often diminishing proximally, glabrous or scabrous. 2n = 36.
treatment.discussion: Variety eastwoodiae occurs from Point Reyes north to about Point Arena.
